page.title: 12SUTTON HOUSING TRUST
page.content: The Sutton Housing Trust was founded in 1894 under the will of Mr.W.R.Sutton who left one and a half million pounds for the provision of"model low_rented dwellings" for the poor of London and other towns.The Sutton estate at Padgate is well designed, the houses set in courts with many walk_only areas and at least 15 play areas for children. Shrubs and trees have been planted wherever possible and so,though the gardens are small,the general landscaping gives many householders the impression that they are in rural surroundings.The landscaped areas are very well maintained by a team of workmen, and the tenants have pride in their area. The design of this estate is in contrast to the "ribbon development" of the post war council estates nearby.
